Belgium:
Edict prohibiting all trade with the enemy issued.
Archduke Albert marries Infanta Isabella.
Archduke Albert and Infanta Isabella arrive in the Low Countries.
Archduke Albert and Infanta Isabella make their Joyous Entry into Brussels.
Burma:
Fall of First Toungoo Empire after Pegu sacked by the Arakanese and Toungoo (city) forces.  Siam captures the entire Tenasserim coast to Martaban.  Arakanese capture delta ports; appoint Portuguese mercenary de Brito governor of Syriam
Siamese invasions take Martaban (1600) and Lan Na (1602) (to 1605)
Cambodia: The Spanish in Cambodia were massacred by Malay warlords.
Chile: The Real Situado, an annual payment of silver from Potosí to Chile, is established.
Indinesia:
The van Neck expedition returns to Europe. The expedition makes a 400 per cent profit. (to 1600)
Leaving Europe the previous year, a fleet of eight ships under Jacob van Neck was the first Dutch fleet to reach the 'Spice Islands' of Maluku.
Sweden: War against Sigismund ends, resulting in deposition of King Sigismund; Sigismund's followers targeted in second Kalmar Bloodbath and the Åbo Bloodbath
